caption: This place it's such a unique dining experience. My wife and i have never eaten in such aelegant and wonderful restaurant. We are looking to return to New Orleans just so we can dine here again. The chef here is fabulous. We ordered the three entrees. The chef came out of the kitchen and ask us our likes and dislikes, then he returned to the kitchen and create a unique dish for each entree. Each and every evening the menu changes. Food is created using local Farm to Table products that are gathered each and every day from the local markets. Recommend this place to everyone we meet and speak with, that will be in tye New Orleans area and are looking for this type of one of a kind dining experience.
Small, elegant with great food.
Great small family run restaurant, friendly service, excellent food, particularly happy as a single dinner I could do a five course degustation, every course was great. Excellent value.

We booked as we had heard this was a great place to eat. Sadly the night we went only another table in the restaurant was taken. Not sure if that was because it was a Sunday. Anyway we couldn’t understand why as the food was really good, the waiter really attentive and the ambiance lovely. I would definitely recommend dining here. The fried green tomatoes with shrimp, the quail and BBQ shrimp are really worth trying.
We have eaten here many times in the past 22 years, we visit whenever in NOLA, always worth it!  Excellent service, quiet
Nice intimate place to eat. I had the fish and my wife had the pork chop both were excellent.
Tried the “Feed Me!” 4 course meal! Absolutely delicious!! Excellent service and Chef Wells is soooo talented!
Tried the 5 course meal. Was delicious and the server was a joy
Excellent!!!!
Amazing restaurant, get the "Feed Me" option and receive a crafted to your tastes chefs menu!!! Simply amazing!

We had a great a experience at this place, it was right next to our hotel, the waiter Sam was friendly, chef wells did an excellent job. The food was delicious, although it did take a little longer than usual, it was worth the wait. I will come back next time we are in NOLA
Just walking by, looked very inviting. Had excellent,  attentive service.  Chef was amazing!

This is our second trip to New Orleans in the last five years. My wife happened upon the Louisiana Bistro in our first trip. We ordered the Feed Me option both times. Chef Wells did a fantastic job with each other our five courses. Everything was cooked to perfection, and each sauce was outstanding.
Absolutely amazing! Did the four course chefs choice and am so glad we did! Service was excellent and very friendly. Food was excellent! Very peaceful atmosphere with no rushing!

The service was horrendous, it took 30 minutes for our appetizer to arrive and we ordered it while there were only three occupied tables. The waiter hovered at the kitchen window nearly the entire time while ignoring the tables. He never checked on us to see if we need water refills or anything. Only stopping by to deliver food. With that being said if you are not in a rush and don't mind being forgotten the food was delicious. While the plates were small (after a starter and entree we were still hungry but a trip to Cafe Du Monde for dessert after was perfect) they were superb. We truly enjoyed our fried oyster starter and duck and fish entrees.

We walked in here at 7pm. It's now 8:45 and the food has still not been served. We're getting excuse after excuse...meanwhile other tables who've come in after us are already enjoying their food. A few courses of their food. Unless you've got 4 hours to spend on a meal, avoid this place.
The staff were very accommodating, and the chef made the most delicious tasting menu we've had!

Small place with a small menu. Everything was well prepared and the staff was friendly.  Staff from another restaurant in the area was eating there so I knew it was worth taking a chance on a place I had never heard of.

Chance drop in, but oh my what good luck. Friendly & informative waiter, but NOLA is probably #1 in that catagory, add a great sense of humor and you're havin fun.  Awesome food too, the special was fried catfish sandwiched between jambalya &  etoufee...all good & catfish was perfect!  Great eine list too.  Chef came out each course...off the beaten path and well worth the walk!!

One of the finest restaurants I've ever eaten anywhere in the world. The chef takes traditional ingredients of Louisiana and makes an elegant turn on Cajun recipes. A small establishment that will change your tastes in favor of Louisiana cooking.
Having dinner here at Bistro again tonight....  Deliciously elegant with quaintness along with great food and great personalized service!!!!!!
A foodies dream. Order the feed me menu for on the fly cuisine!! Great food and even better hospitality.

The highlight of the trip to New Orleans. They cater to those of us who are adventurous tasters. Select the "feed me" option, and inform the servers you are not the type who wants "salsa on the side". Each dish is unique. While the rabbit was fine, the memorable dishes were the grilled crawfish on the most delicious sauce ever (grits!) and the frog legs. And wine recommendation was excellent.  Worth the research and the walk to get there.
Catered to my gluten free requests and created an amazing meal!

Pretty Darn Bad,  I had the Duck and was very disapointed. It was tough shoe leather, My friends had the steak. After a few bites they both decided to pass.  They said the meat had a funny smell and they did not want to risk getting sick on our weekend trip.  The waiter reconized they were not eating and offer to prepare something else. In the end he did the right thing and did not charge them for their meal.

The "Feed Me" is the way to go.  Our three course meal had white wine and basil basted shrimp over crab cakes, pheasant with sweet whiskey glaze on candied yams and finished with duck breast and candied figs.  Exquisite.

Absolutely horrible experience. My GF is vegan and when we asked if they could accommodate her, the waiter assured her they would. She ordered a salad that normally came with a bacon vinaigrette dressing and simply asked that the chef substitute something else. She also ordered the Fried Green Tomato. We could hear the chef complaining about it to the point that we offered to pay for our drinks and leave. The waiter apologized and brought out the salad. Half way through, we realized the chef had put the bacon vinaigrette dressing on it! My GF became sick to her stomach and ran to the restroom. The waiter apologized and offered to comp the meal. When we went to leave, the waiter said that since I had eaten most of my dinner and finished our drinks, we had to pay for everything except the salad. Numerous calls to the owner have gone unreturned so this is my only recourse. The chef KNEW she was vegan and intentionally gave her a BACON topped salad. Simply unacceptable!
Absolutely wonderful in every way possible!
Wonderful food & service.  Possibly the best gumbo in town.  Bread Pudding like silk.  Small but very happy space & patrons.
Incredible eating experience!  Definitely go from the feed me experience.   You won't be disappointed!
Great service, gumbo doesn't get any better, and my duck was wonderful.

This looked promising, but was far from it. Lousy service, weak drinks, the appetizers were tiny and the the main dish portions were also nothing special. You got a lot of great things on that street, this is not one of them.
Service was good, but my wife and I were the only ones in there which made things pretty awkward. The appetizer was ok but didn't blow me away.

My wife and I are local natives and have been to every fine dining establishment in the City (except Le Petite Grocery.)  The cooking in this place was on par with any of them.  We decided to try it, to be honest based on price.  We chose the three course Feed Me and did not regret it. You have to be willing to eat whatever Chef Mars is in the mood to make.  It was worth the risk. The first course was crawfish beignets.  They were fried to perfection, crisp on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside.  These were served in a delicious sauce (sorry the name of it escapes me) that was so tasty I wiped the remainders up with french bread. ( I did that with every course).  The second course was a quarter quail over a eid of bacon-infused mixed sauteed greens with a jalapeno hollandaise sauce.  Delicious!  The entree course was rib eye steak over a mixture of roasted brussel sprouts and some salad greens with another sauce that escapes my memory.  Service was adequate but nothing to write home about.  The total bill with a glass of wine each, tax and tip was $150.  This is far less than I would have spent for something similar at Antoine's, Galatoire's or Arnauds.  We will definitely try this again.

I don't normally give a 5 star, but this was one of the best meals I've had.  Go with the "Feed Me" option.  Let the chef make his choices for you, you won't be disappointed.  The only thing I can say bad is that the prices for doing so, even with just the 3 course meal, is expensive.  If you don't mind that, and can afford it, then please, go and try this wonderful restaurant.

Amazing food from a talented chef. We had the amazing Feed Me option and had an wonderful variety of food from the comforting and traditional to the truly sublime. I can't recommend this place high enough if you love great food.

We walked by the restaurant this afternoon, and decided to go there for dinner. Prior to making the reservation, we checked the review in Google+ and someone mentioned the "Feed Me" menu.  The server didn't tell us about it first, but when we asked about it, it is available. 3, 4 or 5 courses, our choice. But what will be on the table is entirely up to the chef, and each table can be different. We ordered the 3 course "Feed Me" menu.  First course - clayfish beignets Second course - tiger shrimps over fish/grit Entree - braised buffalo shortribs over garlic mash potato, top with fried oysters  Both starters are very good. Fresh ingredients and cooked perfectly. But the buffalo shortrib is to die for. It is very tender (meat falling off the bone), juicy and seasoned perfectly. Chef said it was braised for 12 hours. The oysters are big, sweet, and fresh not overcooked.  I will certainly go there again when I'm in town.

The dining area isn't big, about 15 tables, but we had the 5 course "Feed Me" special. The chef comes out and ask if you have any restrictions, the he goes to work. He makes up the menu as he goes and it was AWESOME!!! We would definately reccomend...

Hands down the best meal in New Orleans! While the menu is fantastic I advise you ignore it. Order the _Feed Me_ every time. Chef comes out to your table and talks to you about what you do ad do not like. He then disappears into the kitchen and jazz improvs a three course meal tailored to those tastes.  From the alligator tenderloin gumbo to the blue crab and asparagus every item on the menu is a true treat!  I advise a shot of green Chartreuse with your meal. Go on, be adventurous!  Review by Loki

Sort of a hole-in-the-wall in the Vieux Carre (which seems like an oxymoron, but it really isn't). The flavors are really bold, but beautifully done. One of those meals filled with "Oh my...this is....so good." The duck and the bread pudding are real standouts...  Only drawback was that the waiter didn't mention the specials, which included one of my favorite foods and I would have ordered that for sure.

Prompt, informative, courteous service.  Intimate venue a short walk away from Bourbon Street.  A short but sublime menu with interesting specials.  Reasonably priced.  I had the blackened amberjack with red beans and rice special.  Perfect.  I had the fried green tomatoes appie.  A completely different FGT experience.    Others at my table loved the boudin appie, and the salads are great.  Very happy.  Wish I had done the feed me experience, maybe next year for Jazz Fest.

When a restaurant is kept intentionally small so that the Chef is the only one touch every aspect of your meal it's a good sign. Such is the case with Chef Eric Mars of Louisiana Bistro.  I've been dining there since well before Hurricane Katrina and the experience has always been stellar. The multi course "Feed Me" is particularly deserving of note. Chef Mars comes to the table side and converses with you in detail about what you do and do not like. He then goes into the kitchen and creates a suitable masterpiece.  A gustatory jewel of great price, Louisiana Bistro is one of the best meals in a city that is known globally for its cuisine.
